description: GamesRadar’s video game discussions with all manner of silliness!
title: RadioRadar

episodes.title: GamesRadar E3 2018: The Pre-Show Predictions Podcast
episodes.description: The Big Topics: Sony, Xbox and Nintendo E3 2018 predictions. Further Discussion: EA, Bethesda, Square Enix, Capcom and more. *We appreciate we’re posting this ‘predictions’ podcast during E3. This podcast originally appeared on gamesradar.com but we experienced problems with our FTP server so we’re making it live on this blog and iTunes now. Thanks for your […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 77: One more slow jam for the road
episodes.description: The Big Topic: Not buying an NES Classic Further Discussion: What Remains of Edith Finch, Tumbleseed, Kingdom Hearts 1.5 What we’re into: Games you should play to bring joy into your life Well, this is it – we’ve come to the end of the road. Thank you for joining us on our wild and stupid […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 76: What would make you buy an Xbox Scorpio?
episodes.description: The Big Topic: The Xbox Scorpio’s official specs unveiling Further Discussion: Horizon: Zero Dawn’s wonderful open world What we’re into: Makoto Shinkai’s latest animated masterpiece, Your Name. (yes, the period is part of the title) Microsoft officially released the technical specs for its upcoming console update, Xbox Scorpio, which is great – but are the […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 75: Just when we think we’re out, Destiny 2 pulls us back in
episodes.description: The Big Topic: Destiny 2’s big reveal What we’re into: Snake Pass, Elder Scrolls Legends, and TypeShift are all wonderful Destiny 2 is coming (surprising basically no-one) and will arrive on PS4, Xbox One, and PC this September. And you know what? We’re into it. We gather round to share our thoughts on the reveal trailer’s colorful, […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 74: Proclaiming Persona 5’s PlayStation perfection
episodes.description: The Big Topic: Persona 5’s long development yielded proper results. Further discussion: Living through your Switch bricking and other dead console experiences. Persona 5. It is here. A full four years after its original proposed release date, two months after the GamesRadar crew finally started playing it, and just in time for the game’s release […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 73: Mass Effect: Andromeda stumbles across the finish line, and PAX East is a delight
episodes.description: The Big Topic: Mass Effect: Andro-meh-da Further discussion: The many games of PAX East Pardon the minor, uh, home invasion (and subsequent digression about The Big Lebowski), and permit us some discussion about Mass Effect “My Face Is Tired” Andromeda and our own perceptions about the game based on the weekend’s EA Access preview and […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 72: Talking GDC and the Breath of the Wild/Skyrim connection
episodes.description: The Big Topic: A week with the Nintendo Switch Further discussion: Breath of the Wild’s interlocking systems and expansive world What we’re into: GDC is a ton of fun, you guys Half of the team is hanging out at PAX East this weekend, so David took over hosting duties and ran the podcast right off […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 70: Nintendo Switch is coming in hot

I don’t know what you’re talking about. In episode 70, we get together to chat about some games that are near and dear […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 68: E3 goes public, Horizon: Zero Dawn, and our first spoilercast

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 65: Resident Evil 7 is that damn good

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 63: The Nintendo Switch is unveiled
episodes.description: The Big Topic: Our thoughts on the Nintendo Switch’s price, tech, and launch lineup. After a surprisingly strong teaser back in October, all eyes have been on Nintendo and it’s upcoming console/handheld hybrid Switch. Nintendo revealed the price ($299!), the release date (March 3!) and the launch games (Zelda and… a cow milking thing?), and […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 40: The NES Classic says, “What’s up, everybody?”

The GamesRadar+ crew deftly avoids walking into traffic to discuss the cultural phenomenon that is Pokemon Go, […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 39: Don’t call it a comeback

This week, the GamesRadar+ crew returns to the mics to talk about all sorts of Japanese games, like Zero Time Dilemma, Grand Kingdom, and Tokyo Mirage […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 38: Laser Fear
episodes.description: Games covered this week: Street Fighter 5, Layers of Fear, Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy 13 The latest episode of RadioRadar+ weighs in on Street Fighter 5 and its launch package, which some critics have found profoundly lacking in punch. We also peel back the creepy techniques used in the new PT-like horror game, Layers of Fear, […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 37: New Game Minus
episodes.description: Games covered this week: Firewatch, Unravel, Quantum Break, Final Fantasy … 12? This week the podcast crew examines the impending hiatus of Assassin’s Creed, the Quantum Break backlash, the burning desire to play Firewatch and what happens when you get a bit wrapped up in the cute little Limbo-like, Unravel. Anthony also conveys what it’s […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 36: Hyrule HD
episodes.description: Games covered this week: The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess HD, XCOM 2, Rusty Lake Hotel, Oxenfree, Lego Star Wars: The Force Awakens The RadioRadar+ crew reports back on Twilight Princess HD – and whether it deserved all that love … or all that hate, depending on who you talk to. Meanwhile, Susan’s still on her […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 35: The Long Division Episode
episodes.description: Games covered this week: The Division, The Witness, Marvel’s Lego Avengers, Resident Evil Zero HD, Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain The RadioRadar Crew spends an episode unpacking The Division’s dense New York plague-ground, the wobbly construction of Marvel’s Lego Avengers and whether one of Resident Evil’s oddest games holds up in an HD […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 34: Quiet on Pony Island
episodes.description: It’s Weird Game Week on the RadioRadar+ show, with thorough looks at delightfully off-kilter games like Oxenfree (a teen-infused mystery), Undertale (you’ve probably heard about it by now) and the insidious self-hacking game, Pony Island. The crew also discusses whether self-aware games can go too far, and whether story-focused developers need to take it down […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 33: The MUD Bucket
episodes.description: This week’s episode of RadioRadar+ ponders the agelessness of video game characters. Should they live forever? Should they be allowed to retire with dignity? Should they flaunt Luis Vuitton goods? (Yes, also yes, and … absolutely.) After that, stay a while and hear about Sophia Tong’s epic history as a former MUD overlord – that’s […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 32: When Things Are Big That Should Be Small
episodes.description: The RadioRadar+ show is back after a holiday break, ready to ponder the price of the Oculus Rift and what it could mean for PlayStation VR. After that: let the spoilers flow through you as we talk about that thing that happened in Star Wars: The Force Awakens, get psyched for the promise of Psychonauts 2, […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 31: Return of the MGS Guy
episodes.description: After a disastrous (but spoiler-free) attempt to review Star Wars: The Force Awakens – without having seen it – the RadioRadar+ crew delve into games that, like Star Wars, have made a triumphant comeback after a tarnished turn or two. The show also covers what it means for Hideo Kojima to be free, and whether […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 30: Final Fantasy 7 and the best of PSX
episodes.description: The PlayStation Experience hosted a whirlwind of big announcements (there’s a Ni no Kuni 2?) and a strong push toward VR from Sony, but it seems you can’t call something “PSX” for short without having it overshadowed by an iconic PlayStation 1 game. Yup, it’s the Final Fantasy 7 Remake episode, which – according to […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 29: The Pre-Thanksgiving Semi-Special
episodes.description: The RadioRadar crew embarks on a bloody sojourn with the old hunters this week in a return to Bloodborne and its new expansion. Meanwhile, they make a case for another difficult oddity, Spelunker World, and figure out just who (if anyone) is doing microtransactions and card packs and all that stuff the right way. It […]

episodes.title: RadioRadar+ Podcast 28: Actually, it’s Dr. Eggman’s Monster
episodes.description: Is Star Wars: Battlefront a little too lean for its own good? This week’s episode looks at how different 2015’s last big shooter really is. The RadioRadar+ crew also ventures back into Fallout 4 – a world in which bugs aren’t as destructive as you might think – and explores Lara Croft’s latest in Rise […]
